title: Can't add annotations via the API anymore - any workaround?
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

Previously, I could programmatically get and add annotations associated with a document via `projects/{project_id}/documents/{doc_id}/annotations` (with GET and POST requests).

I upgraded to 1.5.5 recently and to my surprise, apart from the api breaking changes, I see no more endpoint for annotations (see https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/v1.5.5/backend/api/urls.py). I can get annotations associated with a doc via `projects/{project_id}/examples/{id}` and grabbing the "annotations" key. But I can't update it. A put or patch request can only update the `meta` or `text` field.

Any idea what the workaround might be? I want to upgrade and use the latest version, and I know that the docs endpoints will be deprecated so I'm trying to move away from them.

How can one update annotations via the API using the examples model/framework?

Thanks a lot for your help!

<!--
Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: MacOS
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   When you install doccano: 
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose up
